net.middell.combo
Class TextResourceResolver

java.lang.Object
  net.middell.combo.TextResourceResolver
All Implemented Interfaces:
Function<String,TextResource>
public class TextResourceResolver
extends Object
implements Function<String,TextResource>

Maps paths, specified e.g. in a URL, to text-based resources located in the filesystem.

The mapping can be configured by mounting a set of directories which are searched for resources matching the provided paths.

Author:
Gregor Middell

TextResourceResolver

public TextResourceResolver()
Method Detail

resolve

public TextResourceCombo resolve(Iterable<String> paths)
                          throws IllegalArgumentException
Maps an ordered sequence of paths to a combination of text-based resources.

Parameters:
paths - the list of paths to be mapped
Returns:
a new resource combo containing the mapped resources
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - in case a path cannot be mapped, e.g. because a corresponding file does not exist, cannot be read or the specified path references a file not contained in the mounted directories

mount

public void mount(String root,
                  File directory,
                  String sourceURI,
                  Charset charset,
                  long maxAge)
           throws IllegalArgumentException
Registers a local directory with the resolver, whose contents it can subsequently resolve.

Parameters:
root - the path prefix under which resources in this directory will be mounted
directory - the directory to be mounted
sourceURI - a base URI via which resources contained in this directory can be directly retrieved. This is used e.g. in the rewriting of links to external resources
charset - the character set with with text-based resources in this directory are encoded
maxAge - the maximum time a resource of this directory may be cached by browsers/HTTP proxies
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - in case the provided file is not a directory or cannot be read

apply

public TextResource apply(String input)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
Maps a path to a text-based resource.

Specified by:
apply in interface Function<String,TextResource>
Parameters:
input - the path to be mapped
Returns:
the mapped resource
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - in case the path cannot be mapped, e.g. because a corresponding file does not exist, cannot be read or the specified path references a file not contained in the mounted directories
